alert.note: Alert for Suffolk (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 5:58PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of the central City of Suffolk through 645 PM EDT... At 557 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Suffolk, or near Holland, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, frequent cloud to ground lightning, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Downtown Suffolk, Holland, Suffolk, Whaleyville, Kings Fork, Wilroy, Lummis, Nurney, Kilby, Suffolk Airport, Saunders and Magnolia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
